synopsis.text:
Baloo, a young elephant trainer, and his beloved white elephant, Jumbo, embark on an unexpected journey when they find themselves washed ashore on the enchanting Beautiful Island, a hidden paradise brimming with delectable food, cheerful creatures, and a benevolent ruler known as The King. As Baloo and Jumbo quickly forge friendships with the island's inhabitants, their tranquil existence is disrupted by a looming conflict between two neighboring islands.

This colorful and meticulously animated musical is the first anime feature produced by Sanrio, based on a story by Yanase Takashi. While it shares the same roots as Takashi's The Bell of Chirin, Jumbo offers a stark contrast in style, exuding a light-hearted and cartoonish charm that belies its serious underlying themes. Fans of Takashi's earlier work, The Kindly Lion (1970), will appreciate the film's unique blend of vivid animation and a bold dramatic form.

Jumbo is a delightful cinematic experience that will captivate both children and animation enthusiasts alike, providing an engaging and thought-provoking tale set against the backdrop of a seemingly idyllic island paradise on the brink of war.
